answers.author: Martha Perego
answers.text:
When the local government has a residency requirement for the manager and housing is either very expensive or limited, the most common strategy is for the local government to provide financial assistance, in addition to salary, that would allow the manager to purchase a home that suits their family needs and financial situation.  This is a reasonable strategy because the alternative would be to pay a salary high enough to cover area mortgages.  Housing assistance can include funds for a down payment and/or loan assistance.  The loan should be secured so that the local government's interest is covered and the terms of the loan as well as repayment should be clearly spelled out in an agreement.  For example, who benefits from any gain in equity?   Having the city own a home that they rent to the manager isn't always a desirable option because the manager doesn't have the benefit of home ownership, the home may not be suitable to the family's needs,  and the city has yet another structure to maintain.  Examples of housing assistance are included in the ICMA Model Employment Agreement. Here is the link http://icma.org/en/icma/career_network/career_resources/model_employment_agreement

author: Gary Holland
text: A community has a shortage of housing for its next city manager. What are some successful scenarios for the city to acquire or build a home for the city manager in terms of how it is incorporated into the compensation package? For example, housing in lieu of a higher salary, or housing provided as a benefit in addition to salary.
title: Housing As Part of Benefits Package
